result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy J Petri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Washington County case 13CF314

superMiscConds.notes: Court Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amy J Petri in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) concurrent to present sentence defendant is serving from Washington County - 13CF314 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condtion of Extended Supervision; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision if not already paid; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
From Taycheedah Correctional Institution for June 25, 2014 Plea/Sentencing Hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
filed, to be produced from Taycheedah Correctional.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
